root.TEXT:
Record date: 2098-02-22
Kekela Team 3 Intern Admission
Name: Danny Nielson MR#: 9156593 Admit Date: February 21, 2098 Onc Attending: Dr. Quadri Onc PA: Edward Quiambao PCP: Ulises Lopez Admitting intern: Ulyssa Neff Code: FULL
Source: Patient
Chief Complaint: diarrhea
History of Present Illness: 77-year-old gentleman with Stage IIIB diffuse large B-cell lymphoma s/p 4 cycles of CHOP-R with increased PET avidity of left groin nodal mass and biopsy c/w DLBCL then s/p R-ICE cycle #2. Now s/p 40 gray XRT to limited recurrence site in left groin. He was hospitalized recently for neutropenia and fevers, received cefepime and vancomycin, and was discharged on 2/2/2098. As per d/c summary, he received cefepime for E. coli and VRE UTI (though this is a little confusing since urine culture negative that admission, and positive for these organisms in 11/2097). During most recent admission he was found to be C. diff positive, but appears to have had incomplete course of Flagyl. Since discharge, patient reports not feeling the same. He has had crampy abdominal pain, diarrhea, and experienced some lightheadedness this morning.
ROS: Denies fevers, sweats, chills. Denies HA. Denies CP, respiratory sx, urinary difficulty, N/V.
Past Medical History: 1. Wegener's granulomatosis 2. bilateral knee repair 12 years ago 3. right-sided hip repair 4. diabetes mellitus type II 5. hiatal hernia 6. coronary artery disease a. Cath from 11/2097: Severe left main (60% ostial), mid LAD (60%), and RCA (100%), patent LIMA 7. renal transplant donor in the 2060s 8. aortic stenosis with (valve area 1 peak trans AV gradient is 37 mmHg) 9. CHF (EF 36%) 10. atrial flutter s/p cardioversion 11. diffuse large B-cell lymphoma
ONC history - as per prior notes 3/97: Mr. Nielson was in his usual state of health until he presented with LLE edema and bilateral groin swelling, left>right. 4/97: CT scan of the abdomen revealed retroperitoneal adenopathy. CT scan of the pelvis revealed a chain of retrocrural nodes in front of the aorta and vena cava as well as bulky adenopathy in the external iliac chain with an iliac mass measuring 3.0 to 3.5 cm in diameter on the left side. The largest node in the inguinal area measured approximately 6.0 cm. 4/18/97: biopsy of left groin mass c/w DLBCL. CD20+, CD 79a+, Pax5+, CD30-, CD15- 4/97: PET: Increased FDG uptake throughout the retroperitoneum, left pelvis and proximal left lower extremity which corresponds with extensive lymphadenopathy. 4/24/97: Bone Marrow Biopsy: without evidence of involvement 5/01/97 Cycle #1 of CHOP-R at 75% Adria and Cytoxan dose 5/22/97 Cycle #2 of CHOP-R at 100% Adria and Cytoxan dose - Neulasta 6/5/97: PET: Interval enlargement of left groin mass but less intense FDG uptake. Enlargement in size may represent necrosis from treatment effect. Improvement in left iliac adenopathy and resolution of retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. Small pancreatic body cystic lesion - may be IPMT. 6/12/97: Cycle #3 of CHOP-R at 100% Adria and Cytoxan dose - Neulasta 7/4/97: Cycle #4 of CHOP-R at 100% Adria and 75% Cytoxan dose - Neulasta 7/6/97: PET: No signficant change in left external iliac and left inguinal hypermatabolic lymphadenopathy, likely right greater trochanteric bursitis 7/97: Re biopsy left groin: DIFFUSE LARGE B-CELL LYMPHOMA. AREAS OF FIBROSIS AND CHRONIC INFLAMMATION 8/1/97 Cycle #1 of R-ICE with dose-reduced Ifos and carboplatin because of nephrectomy. 8/31/97 Cycle #2 of R-ICE with dose-reduced Ifos and carboplatin 9/20/97 - 11/8/97 - 40 gray XRT to left groin 1/23/98 - PET/CT with slight local progression of left thigh lesion by CT
Allergies: NKDA
Medications (upon admission) Micronase 10 mg po q day Lipitor 10 mg po q day Lasix 40 mg po q day Multivitamin Prednisone 5 mg po q day ASA 325 mg/d Amiodarone 200 mg/d Carvedilol 3.125 mg BID Flomax 0.4 mg/d Warfarin 5 mg on odd days and 2.5 mg on even days
Social History: The patient lives at home in Port Arthur, Indiana. His wife is now at home with 24 hour care because of heart disease. Formerly ran Cisco's Security Department in Crossville. He has four sons and two daughters; one of son's currently running security. He lost one son to ARF and it was to this son that he donated a kidney. He has grandchildren, four boys and four girls. Tobacco: 1ppd from 14-50, quit 26 years ago. Significant EtOH in past, none current.
Family History: Father: Died of colon cancer at 87yo Mother: Died of breast cancer at 90yo
Exam: Vitals: BP 118/82, HR 100; RR 20 T 97.3 O2 sat 98% on 2L Gen: Obese, chronically ill-appearing older gentleman lying in bed, easily arousable, good sense of humor. HEENT: PERRL, OP without erythema, exudates; mucous membranes dry; no scleral icterus Pulm: CTA with good air movement bilaterally, coarse breath sounds at bases, but no appreciable crackles. Cor/Cardiac: irreg/irreg, SEM IV/VI murmur heard throughout precordium, neck veins flat Abdomen: S/ND, +BS throughout, very mild tenderness to palpation, negative Murphy's, no rebound; no HSM, palpable/pulsatile masses Extremity: 1+ pitting edema bilaterally, distal pulses 2+ bilaterally Neurological: CN II-XII grossly intact, though tongue c mild deviation to right; strength 5/5 all major muscle groups; DTR's 2+ bilat. UE/LE, downgoing toes bilaterally.
Laboratory
Hematology
Hematology Detail for NIELSON, DANNY W
MAH YC LAB 21-Feb-2098 10:12 Accession# 5541E69701
Test Description Result Flags Ref. Range Units
WBC 3.4 L (4.5-11.0) th/cmm HCT 29.6 L (41.0-53.0) % HGB 9.7 L (13.5-17.5) gm/dl RBC 3.80 L (4.50-5.90) mil/cmm PLT 69 L (150-350) th/cumm MCV 78 L (80-100) fl MCH 25.5 L (26.0-34.0) pg/rbc MCHC 32.7 (31.0-37.0) g/dl RDW 21.0 H (11.5-14.5) % DIFFERENTIAL REQUEST RECEIVED Diff Method Auto Poly 83 H (40-70) % Lymphs 14 L (22-44) % Monos 3 L (4-11) % EOS 0 (0-8) % Basos 0 (0-3) % Absolute Neuts 2.83 (1.8-7.7) th/cmm Absolute Lymphs 0.48 L (1.0-4.8) th/cmm Absolute Monos 0.11 L (0.2-0.4) th/cmm Absolute EOS 0.01 L (0.1-0.3) th/cmm Absolute Basos 0.00 (0.0-0.3) th/cmm Aniso 2+ H (None) Hypo 2+ H (None) Macrocytes None (None) Microcytes 3+ H (None)
Confidential Material Please Handle Appropriately.
Chemistry Chemistry Detail for NIELSON, DANNY W
MAH YC LAB 21-Feb-2098 10:12 Accession# 5541E69701
Test Description Result Flags Ref. Range Units
Plasma Sodium 135 (135-145) mmol/L Plasma Potassium 3.0 L (3.4-4.8) mmol/L Plasma Chloride 99 L (100-108) mmol/L Plasma Carbon Dioxide 26.1 (23.0-31.9) mmol/L Calcium 8.3 L (8.5-10.5) mg/dl Plasma Urea Nitrogen 27 H (8-25) mg/dl Plasma Creatinine 1.6 H (0.6-1.5) mg/dl Plasma Glucose 169 H (70-110) mg/dl Total Protein 5.0 L (6.0-8.3) g/dl Albumin 2.4 L (3.3-5.0) g/dl Globulin 2.6 (2.6-4.1) g/dl Total Bilirubin 0.6 (0.0-1.0) mg/dl Alkaline Phosphatase 53 (45-115) U/L Transaminase-SGPT 12 (10-55) U/L Transaminase-SGOT 23 (10-40) U/L Lactic Dehydrogenase 266 H (110-210) U/L
Confidential Material Please Handle Appropriately.
EKG NSR at 90, left axis, 1st degree AVB. RBBB pattern, unchanged from prior
Assessment and Plan: 77-year-old gentleman with Stage IIIB diffuse large B-cell lymphoma s/p 4 cycles of CHOP-R, s/p 2 cycles R-ICE, s/p XRT and refractory disease in L groin, presents with several weeks of diarrhea and crampy abdominal pain and recent evidence of C. difficile positivity, and possible incomplete duration of therapy. 1. Diarrhea, crampy abdominal pain. a. Check C. diff, stool cultures b. IVF, follow O2 sats given low EF c. Follow abdominal exam d. Treat with flagyl 500mg PO q8h 2. Acute on chronic RF: (Cr to 1.6 from 1.5 and slightly elevated BUN), likely 2/2 dehydration, recent renal U/S normal. a. Will follow Cr closely, hope for improvement post-hydration 3. DLBCL a. Pancytopenic. Cont to monitor, will reconsider restarting Neupogen depending on trend. b. Groin mass, long-term plan for resection; eval scheduled for 2/26. 4. DM a. Continue outpatient regimen of micronase 10mg qd; monitor FS and cover with RISS prn 5. Cardiac a. Pump: EF 36% i. Carvedilol ii. Hold lasix for now, given dehydration b. Rhythm: afib i. Continue amiodarone, carvedilol, coumadin c. Ischemia: known CAD i. continue ASA, lipitor, carvedilol 6. Wegener's a. Continue prednisone 5mg PO qd 7. Prophylaxis a. On coumadin, encourage OOB, nexium. 8. Code status: Full
Ulyssa Neff, MD Team 3 intern #50260
